goal.ch: 學習動物行為的知識並應用到實際生活周遭的觀察中，進而能靈活運用於自己有興趣的問題。
goal.en: “To learn the knowledge of ethology, and to apply it to our surrounding.  Furthermore, may use it in various subjects.“

outline.ch:
“Week  1. Introduction of Ethology
Week  2. Natural selection, Ecology and Behavior
Week  3. Innate behavior
Week  4. Competition
Week  5. Predation
Week  6. Camouflage
Week  7. Sexual selection
Week  8. Parental care and Mating systems
Week  9. Discussions
Week 10. Breeding strategies
Week 11. Selfishness and Altruism
Week 12. Co-operation and Helping
Week 13. Hierarchy
Week 14. Social animals
Week 15. Signals and Communication
Week 16. Migration
Week 17. Learning behavior
Week 18. Conclusions“
outline.en:
“Week  1. Introduction of Ethology
Week  2. Natural selection, Ecology and Behavior
Week  3. Innate behavior
Week  4. Competition
Week  5. Predation
Week  6. Camouflage
Week  7. Sexual selection
Week  8. Parental care and Mating systems
Week  9. Discussions
Week 10. Breeding strategies
Week 11. Selfishness and Altruism
Week 12. Co-operation and Helping
Week 13. Hierarchy
Week 14. Social animals
Week 15. Signals and Communication
Week 16. Migration
Week 17. Learning behavior
Week 18. Conclusions“

textbook.ch:
“Principal of Animal Behavior, 2nd edition, L. A. Dugatkin Norton, New York/London.
Perspectives on Animal Behavior, 3rd edition, J Goodenough, B. McGuire, E. Jakbo, John Wiley ＆ Sons, Inc., USA.
An Introduction to Behavioral Ecology, 3rd edition, J. R. Krebs ＆ N. B. Davies, Blackwell, Oxford, UK.
Animal Behavior: An Introduction To Behavioral Mechanisms Development And Ecology, 2nd Edition, Mark Ridley, Blackwell, Oxford, UK.“
textbook.en:
“Principal of Animal Behavior, 2nd edition, L. A. Dugatkin Norton, New York/London.
Perspectives on Animal Behavior, 3rd edition, J Goodenough, B. McGuire, E. Jakbo, John Wiley ＆ Sons, Inc., USA.
An Introduction to Behavioral Ecology, 3rd edition, J. R. Krebs ＆ N. B. Davies, Blackwell, Oxford, UK.
Animal Behavior: An Introduction To Behavioral Mechanisms Development And Ecology, 2nd Edition, Mark Ridley, Blackwell, Oxford, UK.“

instructMethod.ch:
講授
研討


其他

gradMethod.ch:
“50％ Presentation
50％ Discussion
1. Every student-group (1~2) presents ~30 min of any behavior subject and leading discussion.
2. 2~3 student-group presentations each week. Student-group grading the 50％.
3. This class requires sufficient participation and English listening comprehansion.  
4. If you do not come to the class more than six times, it’s likely that you will fail on this class.
5. If you do not come to the first class, please drop it.
6. To be aware! This class might be easily to pass, but also easily to fail, if you do not come to the class often.“
gradMethod.en:
“50％ Presentation
50％ Discussion
1. Every student-group (1~2) presents ~30 min of any behavior subject and leading discussion.
2. 2~3 student-group presentations each week. Student-group grading the 50％.
3. This class requires sufficient participation and English listening comprehansion.  
4. If you do not come to the class more than six times, it’s likely that you will fail on this class.
5. If you do not come to the first class, please drop it.
6. To be aware! This class might be easily to pass, but also easily to fail, if you do not come to the class often.“
